resources.string:
Important notes

All the dB in this software are Decibels relative to full scale (dBFS). There is no simple way to convert dBFS to acoustics dB (e.g. dB SPL or dBA). A full-scale sine wave is designated 0 dBFS. The dBA in this software is a simple minded A-weighting dBFS.

Select button operation

Click on a button to cycle through a set of possible values. The buttons are:

Sampling Rate
Selects the sampling rate, in samples/second

Sample Resolution
Selects the number of frequency bins. More bins provides better resolution, but takes more compute power and slower responds.

Magnitude Scale
Selects minimum value displayed (in dB)

View/scale
In view mode, touching the plot area moves the cursor
In scale mode, moving or "pinching" scales and zooms the x axis.

run/stop
stop freezes the display, making it easier to inspect the waveform.
run resumes analyzing samples.

on/test
test mode displays an algoritmically generated waveform.
on analyzes the microphone input signal.
